ARTICLE.TITLE: KZN contributes 44% of new Covid-19 cases in SA, but latest daily rise 'less than previous weeks'
ARTICLE.TEXT:
KZN recorded nearly 50% of all new cases on Tuesday.

However, this was 1 098 cases – the lowest number of new cases the province had recorded in six weeks.

Health Minister Zweli Mkhize said KZN was expected to peak in the coming weeks.

While KwaZulu-Natal accounted for nearly half of all newly reported Covid-19 cases in South Africa on Tuesday, new case numbers for Tuesday were the lowest in the past few weeks, the province said.



A statement from the KZN health department on Wednesday revealed 1 098 new cases, the lowest in the province in six weeks.

"KwaZulu-Natal province contributed 44% of the new cases nationally. The province had been contributing more than a third of the new cases daily for the past 10 days," the statement read.

The new cases, however, meant that KZN became the second highest in the number of laboratory-confirmed cases countrywide with over 100 000 cases, overtaking the Western Cape and only behind Gauteng, the highest populated province in South Africa.

"The province has recorded 73 new Covid-19 related deaths."

ALSO READ | Minister Motshekga's husband not involved in production of hand sanitisers for schools

The department said the deaths were not over a 24-hour period.

"These deaths did not happen in the past 24 hours. Due to late reporting and high number of patients dying as persons under investigation (PUIs), there is a delay in reporting deaths."

Supplied Supplied: KZN Department of Health

So far, KZN contributed 14%, or 1 523 deaths countrywide. The province continues to be the fourth highest in terms of deaths.



Last week, Health Minister Zweli Mkhize visited the Clairwood, Northdale and Richmond hospitals as part of his preparation for a peak on the east coast.

Mkhize said while numbers were dropping slightly, KZN was expected to peak in the coming weeks.
